title: The most urgent alerts came in the middle of the night.
Camp Mystic in Texas, Where 20 Children Are Missing, Is Nearly a Century Old
summary: Camp Mystic, on the banks of the Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas, has been operated by generations of the same family since the 1930s.

title: The mother of two rescued campers relays their story.
States Brace for Added Burdens of Trump’s Tax and Spending Law
summary: With the president’s domestic policy law signed, states will have to administer many of the cuts and decide how much they can spend to keep their citizens insured and fed.

title: Court Rejects Effort to Keep Migrants From Being Sent to South Sudan
summary: After the Supreme Court ruled that the deportations could move forward, a last-ditch attempt to block them with a new lawsuit faltered.

title: Hamas Says It’s Ready to ‘Immediately” Return to Truce Negotiations
summary: It was not immediately clear whether the group was demanding any significant changes to the plan for a 60-day truce, hostage-for-prisoner swaps and talks on a permanent end to the Gaza war.

title: China Has Paid a High Price for Its Dominance in Rare Earths
summary: Dust and groundwater contaminated with heavy metals and radioactive chemicals pose a health threat that the authorities have been trying to address for years.

title: China’s Rare Earth Origin Story, Explained
summary: Low environmental standards helped China become the world’s low-cost producer of rare earths, but Beijing was also focused on helping the industry.

title: Celebrating the Fourth of July Across the Country
summary: Displays of patriotism were evident at parades and hot dog eating contests, even at a time of deep political divisions among Americans.

title: Some Ways Fireworks Impact Animals and People
summary: Firework displays can harm animals and create bursts of pollution with lingering effects, but there are ways to mitigate them.

title: Joey Chestnut Returns to Nathan’s Hot Dog Eating Contest
summary: Mr. Chestnut, who was barred last year over an endorsement deal with a vegan-meat company, and Miki Sudo easily won their respective contests but did not break records.

title: A Solid Report Card for the Markets, Despite Shock and Worry
summary: While the Trump administration has engaged in continual disruptions, most investors have prospered.

title: Canadian Buyers Are Dropping Out of the U.S. Housing Market
summary: Search activity for American listings has plummeted in the wake of President Trump’s unpredictable trade war, according to new data.

title: Madre Fire Grows to 70,800 Acres, Prompting Evacuations in California
summary: The blaze is burning in a rural area of San Luis Obispo County, in the central coast, but its smoke has spread to nearby counties.

title: Brief but Violent Storms in New Jersey Leave 3 Dead
summary: Powerful gusts blew down trees in central New Jersey on Thursday, killing three people who were in their cars.

title: Tropical Depression Forms Just Off the Southeastern U.S.
summary: The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to South Carolina through the weekend. Forecasters expect it to become a tropical storm on Saturday.

title: Joseph Giordano, Surgeon Who Helped Save Reagan’s Life, Dies at 84
summary: He had built one of the country’s leading trauma centers in Washington, which made it possible for his team to respond quickly after the president was shot.

title: Move Over, $100 Lobster Salad. In the Hamptons, These Melons Cost $400.
summary: Gourmet grocery stores are upping their game in the Hamptons, serving a welcoming wealthy clientele.

title: Mamdani Once Claimed to Be Asian and African American. Should It Matter?
summary: Zohran Mamdani’s responses on a 2009 college application were criticized by his mayoral rivals. The blowback was dismissed by his supporters as a politically motivated attack.

title: We Want to Hear From You: Are You Frustrated by Census and Racial Categories?
summary: Americans are routinely asked to check off boxes about their race and ethnicity, but many say they do not see themselves reflected in the options.

title: What Tourists in Martha’s Vineyard Showed Me About Being Indigenous
summary: In my parents’ gift shop, I learned about being Native.

title: Top Hochul Aide Resigns After Being Accused of Sexual Harassment
summary: Avi Small, who had served as Gov. Kathy Hochul’s longtime press secretary, was accused of inappropriately touching another male aide.

title: Fatally Injured Teenager Is Discovered on Top of a N.Y.C. Subway Car
summary: A 15-year-old boy could be the latest victim of subway surfing, a dangerous practice of riding on the roofs of train cars that has lured New York City youth for decades.

title: Anna Ornstein, Psychoanalyst Who Survived the Holocaust, Dies at 98
summary: Despite the unspeakable horror of her youth, she embraced a school of psychotherapy that stresses empathy and the belief that everyone can change for the better.
